info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:24AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Otsego, Broome, west central Delaware, southern Chenango, Susquehanna and northwestern Wayne Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 324 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Brisben to Windham. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Binghamton, Vestal, Johnson City, Endicott, Kirkwood, Conklin, Sidney, Jackson, Walton and Sanford. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 1 and 6. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 67 North and 84. Interstate 88 between 1 and 11. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 217 and 230. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
